Detailed Description

The class SmsSocket provides the handling of SmsSockets.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

SmsSocket::SmsSocket (  SmsPortNo  sms_port_no = InvalidSmsPortNo  ) 
 

Initializes the sms socket with a sms port number (if given).

SmsSocket::~SmsSocket (   )  [virtual]
 

Member Function Documentation

ExecutionContext* SmsSocket::GetExecutionContext (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns the owner of an active sms socket (this context will get a notification). If the sms socket is inactive the return value will be zero.

SmsPortNo SmsSocket::GetPortNo (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns the port number of the sms socket.

BOOLEAN SmsSocket::Init (  SmsPortNo  sms_port_no,
BOOLEAN  force = FALSE
) 
 

Initializes the sms socket with a sms port number. The method fails if it is already active, any data is still stored to be read. The optional parameter force, will reset sms socket also if it is active, or any data is waiting. In this case the any existing data will be wasted.

BOOLEAN SmsSocket::IsActive (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns if the sms socket is activ in listening to its port.

BOOLEAN SmsSocket::Read (  WString &  wstr  ) 
 

Reads out pending port data in form of unicode characters. This method shall be used if received SMS have textuell content, means 7-bit or unicode characters. Take into account when using this method, the cached data will be cleared, so therefore the Read method (BlobObject) will return no data.

BOOLEAN SmsSocket::Read (  BlobObject &  blob,
INT  no_of_bytes_to_read = -1
) 
 

Reads out pending port data. The parameter no_of_bytes_to_read defines the amount of bytes to read. If this value is -1 all pending data is returned. Return value is TRUE, if there is more data to read. After reading, the data will be deleted. Reading can only been done by the owner.
